iterate

The iterate() function is a function that takes in an iterable. and a callback function. It will then iterate through the iterable. and pass the value, key and A class called the `IterationInfo()`. 


      iterate(value:unknown, key:unknown, info:IterationInfo)
The Iteration info class contains the following things
  • The iteration
  • Whether or not the iteration is first
  • Whether or not the iteration is last
  • Whether or not the iteration is odd
  • Whether or not the iteration is even
  • How many iterations are remaining
  • How many iterations are there
Below is a list of tables that show's the information that is avaliable when iterating through names
Type Value
key 0
value Rich
isFirst true
isLast false
isOdd false
isEven true
iteration 1
remaining 3
count 4
Type Value
key 1
value Manu
isFirst false
isLast false
isOdd true
isEven false
iteration 2
remaining 2
count 4
Type Value
key 2
value Theo
isFirst false
isLast false
isOdd false
isEven true
iteration 3
remaining 1
count 4
Type Value
key 3
value Mack
isFirst false
isLast true
isOdd true
isEven false
iteration 4
remaining 0
count 4

range

The range() is a function returns a series of numbers based on three numerical parameters. The start,stop,step. If start is greater than step and step is positive then each number will be added by the previous one until the stop is reached. If the opposite is true then the number will be subtracted till the final start is reached.

Here is a demonstration of both
range(1,10,2)
13579
range(10,1,2)
108642

iterate range

The iterateRange() is a function that takes in a function and a an object of options. It will call the Range function Behind the scenes and then return the values that was returned by the callback function. Unlinke the range function you can return anything. It also passes the current value and the

Below is an example of how iterateRange works
iterateRange((value)=> <span>value</span>, { start: 10, stop: 2, step: -2, } )
10864
iterateRange((value)=> <span>value</span>, { start: 10, stop: 20, step: 2, } )
1012141618

execute if

The executeIf() is a function that takes two parameters a boolean and a callback function. If the condition is true then the callback will be called if not nothing will happen. 


    executeIf(value:boolean, callback:Function)

execute unless

The executeUnless() is a function that takes two parameters a boolean and a callback function. If the condition is true then the callback will be called if not nothing will happen. 


      executeUnless(value:boolean, callback:Function)

gap

The <Gap/> component is a component that takes in two props.
  • The spaces
  • The color
  • The spaces are the amount of spaces taken
  • The color is the choice from black, red, green, blue, purple, indigo, orange, yellow, brown, white.
This is an example of gaps being created with the color options mentioned
black
red
green
blue
purple
indigo
orange
yellow
brown
white

projector

The <Projector/> component is a component that projects the content of a template inside of a html area. It does this by taking in a templateId= as a prop. When that happens the component will search for that template with the id then display it's contents.

This element will be displayed by The projector 

        <template id="message">
          <span class="text-lg">
          I come from a template
          </span>
        </template>

island mirror

The <IslandMirror > component is a component that takes in a child. Then an id. if it's child's id is equal to the one passed in then it will pass on the child's attributes. To a parent component called the astro-island.

page link

The <PageLink /> component is a component that uses takes in a path. If the current page matches the path that on the page link a `[aria-current="page"]` will be applied to it and it will apply a default class that uses that selectors as it's class selector.
